abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Urban Streets and
            Transport Project for Chile were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, project sustainability was uncertain, Bank
            performance was highly satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            availability of sufficient financial resources for
            satisfactory implementation of a project can be ensured
            through favorable macroeconomic conditions, sound
            macroeconomic policies and adequate sectoral allocation of
            budget resources. Satisfactory project implementation is
            fundamentally determined by adequate project design, which
            should be kept as simple as possible within the complexities
            of the sector and of the project objectives. Inherent
            institutional weaknesses identified during project
            preparation should be dealt with not only by requiring
            fulfillment of action plans and key indicators, but also by
            establishing w ell-designed and clearly formulated loan
            covenants. In addition to the performance of tasks related
            to general project administration and problem solving,
            planning, and budgeting of supervision missions should
            provide sufficient time in the field to allow adequate
            supervision and quality control of works execution.
